meanings.definition: The acceptance of defeat without struggle or resistance.
meanings.sent1: Her defeatism led her to give up before even trying.
meanings.sent2: His defeatism made him believe he was destined to fail.
meanings.sent3: Despite his defeatism, he still managed to find a way to keep going.
meanings.sent4: The defeatism in the air was palpable, weighing down on everyone.
meanings.sent5: The defeatism in her eyes was heartbreaking, showing the toll of constant setbacks.

meanings.definition: The belief that defeat is inevitable or unavoidable.
meanings.sent1: Their defeatism made them lose hope in any chance of success.
meanings.sent2: The defeatism in his words revealed his lack of faith in victory.
meanings.sent3: Even with defeatism looming, they decided to face the challenge head-on.
meanings.sent4: The defeatism in the room hung heavy, stifling any sense of optimism.
meanings.sent5: The defeatism in his tone made it clear that he had given up on trying to win.
